intro: Labordia molokaiana var. bryanii, commonly known as the Molokaʻi hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming during the summer months. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in coastal areas with well-drained soil. It is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
